alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 03 at 5:51AM MST until January 03 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Periods of snow becoming heavy at times after sunrise. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches. Greatest accumulations are forecast along the southern side of the Mogollon Rim from Williams to Munds Park and Happy Jack to Forest Lakes. Less accumulation is forecast for the northern side of the Mogollon Rim, from Doney Park to Heber. * WHERE...Areas near Doney Park, Flagstaff, Forest Lakes, Heber- Overgaard and Williams. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Additional snow forecast from 5 AM Today to 5 PM Today: Doney Park 1 to 2 inches Flagstaff 2 to 4 inches Forest Lakes 2 to 4 inches Heber-Overgaard 0 to 1 inches Williams 2 to 4 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mogollon Rim; Western Mogollon Rim
